intro: Securinega schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. The plant is known for its fruit, which contains a single, hard, black seed. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky habitats. Botanically, it belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family.
